skillTree.localised_description: A Bellower’s voice is as deep as it loud, carrying across the battlefield and encouraging unbridled carnage.
A small handful of Gnoblars surround this Ogre Lord, their swords always ready to cut and carve.
It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.
Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.
Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Golgfag has seen it all, done it all and killed it all many times over… and won't be stopping anytime soon.
There's no better Maneater to judge whether candidates for recruitment into the Maneaters are Maneater-material than Golgfag Maneater… as you might hope and expect!

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +3 for Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Causes Terror for Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: An army that isn't picky about its meals never goes hungry.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison

skillTree.localised_description: "We find a fight, beat 'em all up, then we loot 'em, then we eat what's left of 'em and then we do it all over again somewhere else. It's the perfect job."

effects.description: Replenishes 20% campaign movement range after winning a battle

skillTree.localised_description: As the most successful Ogre Maneater of them all, Golgfag's reputation has made other famous mercenaries keen to prove their mettle by his side.

effects.description:
Attribute: Unbreakable for Regiments of Renown units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Regiments of Renown units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Regiments of Renown units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Sometimes, the most useful things in life are just left lying around the place for someone to stumble across…

effects.description: Gain 3 random abilities (via ancillaries) at the start of each battle – these abilities will be lost after the battle

skillTree.localised_description: This Tyrant is the size of several large creatures rolled into one. In fact, he ate those several large creatures just yesterday.
Mountains of gold and an overflowing meat-pot are bound to draw in the strongest of warriors.
If you want to get paid, and indeed stay alive, it's sensible to do whatever you're told to do – and be quick about it.
No enemy is immovable when in the path of a furious Ogre's charge.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
This Ogre's greed shall never be sated, for his stomach is as endless as his hunger.
A truly sturdy armour is needed to hold such an overflowing gut in place.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
If the enormous size of this Ogre doesn't incite terror, his bloody, malevolent smile surely will.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When an Ogre charges, the ground itself begins to quake. As it should.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though their intelligence is as pitiful as their physique, one would be a fool not to fear the Gnoblars when massed in numbers.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +3 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: If there's one thing more horrifying than being rushed by a hulking, bloodthirsty beast, it's being rushed by that same creature riding on the back of another equally hulking, bloodthirsty beast.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Ogres' true firepower is as destructive and indelicate as the Ogres themselves.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +12% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblaster units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even ferocious brutes like the Ironguts and Maneaters fight harder in the presence of a worthy leader.

Melee attack: +2 for Ironguts and Maneaters units

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: What the monstrous creatures of the mountains lack in guile, they more than make up for in their stubborn reluctance to die.

Charge bonus: +4 for Sabretusk Pack, Blood Vultures, Yhetees, Thundertusk, Stonehorn, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the most brutal, vicious killer go the richest spoils.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Ironguts, Gnoblars, Pigback Riders and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Ironguts, Gnoblars, Pigback Riders and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Ironguts, Gnoblars, Pigback Riders and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When pelting a helpless enemy with heavy projectiles is so much fun, why bother stopping?

Speed: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When fearsome, brute strength is combined with terrifying speed, the petty weaklings among the enemy can only wet themselves in fear.

Leadership: +5 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn, Blood Vultures, Thundertusk and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn, Blood Vultures, Thundertusk and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Driven by ravenous hunger, the Maneaters feast on the flesh of the fallen.

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Maneaters, Gorgers, Yhetees and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!

effects.description:
Income from sacking and looting settlements: +5%
	(Lord's army)

Income from sacking and looting settlements: +10%
	(Lord's army)

Income from sacking and looting settlements: +15%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Ogres flock to this Butcher's camp, eager for the chance to witness the Great Maw's malevolent power.
Even Ogres are capable of forward planning, especially when it comes to precious loot.
This ravening Ogre Lord is but a mere symbol of his god, whose cancerous power reigns over the Mountains of Mourn.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The grumblings of unrest tend to quiet when under threat of being crushed and eaten.
The mysterious powers of the Great Maw can heal even the deepest of wounds.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

factionEffects.localised_description: From Skavenblight to the streets of Altdorf, Ulthuan’s sacred isles, Cathay and beyond, word of Golgfag's notorious exploits and his battle-hardened Maneaters-for-hire has spread far and wide.

effects.description: Has access to Mercenary Contracts, allowing the Maneaters faction to be hired as mercenaries by other factions
Golgfag can instantly travel to the Client’s settlement once per Mercenary Contract
Cannot make Alliances with other factions

Melee attack: +5 when fighting against a Contract enemy
	(all armies)

Attribute: Immune to Psychology when fighting against a Contract enemy
	(all armies)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

items.colour_text: The Ogres know, just as the Dwarfs do, there's literally nothing so refreshing – or indeed regenerative – as a gigantic tankard brimming with Bugman's finest brew.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

Vigour loss reduction: -15%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Golgfag got his name after an… 'incident' over gold with a human Paymaster who briefly served the company…

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target
